title: How the Fed may interpret the April jobs report and set the economy up for recovery
text: Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi, Alexis Christoforous, Jared Blikre, and Brian Cheung discuss what the April jobs report means for the Fed with Former JP Morgan Chase Chief Economist Anthony Chan, and Hercules Investments CEO James McDonald.

title: Market will take, 'two years,' to recover, says David Bailin, CIO at Citi Private Bank
text:
In April, the U.S. economy shed 20.5 million jobs, while unemployment spiked to 14.7%. Investors, however, are optimistic that the market will recover from this, eventually. Yahoo Finance's Alexis Christoforous and Brian Sozzi discuss with David Bailin, CIO at Citi Private Bank.
This segment originally aired May 8, 2020.

title: With Economy So Bad, Why Are Stocks Up? Should You Buy?
text: The economy does not predict the stock market -- nothing does. Get over it and keep buying into stock index funds.

title: 20.5 million jobs lost in April, unemployment at 14.7% and why wage growth looks better than it is
text: Yahoo Finance’s Ethan Wolf-Mann and Seana Smith discuss the April jobs report and why American wage growth isn’t all that it appears to be in last month's jobs report.

title: Why the Bullish US Dollar Theory Is Flawed
text: Maybe I just love a contrarian view. My dollar theory differs from so many analysts.

title: U.S. Executives Are More Worried About The Economy Than Last Month. Here’s Why.
text: Business leaders are increasingly concerned with survival, including burning through cash reserves.

title: Why The Markets Aren’t Phased By The Highest Unemployment Rate On Record
text: Last week unemployment came in at the highest level on record, why aren't the markets worried?

title: Impact of Dividend Announcements on S&P DJI Dividend Indices
text: By Ari Rajendra, Senior Director, Strategy & Volatility Indices Dividend-paying companies have been in the spotlight as a direct consequence of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and crude oil glut crisis. A combination of strained corporate cash flows and political intervention has seen many companies cancel, cut or postpone payments globally.

title: How To Play The Fed For Cheap 5.2% Dividends
text: Let’s talk about interest rates, which are plunging.

title: Here's when the job market will recover
text: The US job market has completely cratered within mere weeks. And it isn't coming back anytime soon.

title: Oil Investors Are Doomed Even If Oil Prices Recover
text: By Stephen McBride I’m writing this essay because millions of investors are in danger without realizing it. As you probably know, oil has recently taken an historic nosedive.

title: Can stocks and bonds both be right? Making sense of rising equities and ultra-low Treasury yields
text: Both markets are responding, each in its own way, to the same accommodative Fed.

title: US job losses have reached Great Depression levels. Did it have to be that way?
text: The US and Europe have taken different approaches to tackling pandemic-induced unemployment but which is best long term?

title: Record Unemployment: Faces of the Jobless During the Coronavirus
text: As shopping centers emptied, shows were canceled and office towers turned dark, millions of people suddenly found themselves without jobs.
